com.dlsc.flexgantt.command

Class AbstractCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dlsc.flexgantt.command.AbstractCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICommand, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCompoundCommand, AbstractDragAndDropCommand, DefaultAddLayerCommand, DefaultChangeCapacityCommand, DefaultChangeEventlineObjectTimeSpanCommand, DefaultChangeKeyCommand, DefaultChangePercentageCommand, DefaultChangeSpreadsheetValueCommand, DefaultChangeTimelineObjectTimeSpanCommand, DefaultChangeTimeZoneCommand, DefaultChangeValueCommand, DefaultCreateConstraintCommand, DefaultCreateEventlineObjectCommand, DefaultCreateNodeCommand, DefaultCreateRelationshipCommand, DefaultCreateTimelineObjectCommand, DefaultDeleteEventlineObjectCommand, DefaultDeleteNodeCommand, DefaultDeleteRelationshipCommand, DefaultDeleteTimelineObjectCommand, DefaultInsertNodeCommand, DefaultNodeDragAndDropCommand, DefaultReassignNodesCommand, DefaultRemoveLayerCommand, DefaultRowResizeCommand

    public abstract class AbstractCommand
extends Object
implements ICommand
    An abstract superclass implementation to facilitate the creation of new commands. This class handles the naming of commands and provides a default implementation of the redo functionality by simply calling the execution method again.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.10 $
    Author:
    Dirk Lemmermann
    See Also:
    ICommand, Serialized Form

      protected AbstractCommand(String name)
      Creates a new abstract command (can only be called by the subclass constructor).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getName()
      Returns the (display) name of the command.
      boolean isRedoable()
      Returns TRUE if the command can be redone.
      boolean isRelevant()
      Returns TRUE if the command is relevant and should be considered for undo / redo operations.
      boolean isUndoable()
      Returns TRUE if the command can be undone.
      void redoCommand(IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Executes the command again after a call to the command's undo method.
      void setName(String name)
      Sets the (display) name of the command.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractCommand

        protected AbstractCommand(String name)
        Creates a new abstract command (can only be called by the subclass constructor). The command name will be used by some actions in order to create menu items and toolbar buttons, hence it should be a human readable and internationalized name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the command
        Since:
        1.0

        public boolean isRedoable()
        Returns TRUE if the command can be redone. The default implementation always returns TRUE.
        Specified by:

      • redoCommand

        public void redoCommand(IProgressMonitor monitor)
                 throws CommandException
        Executes the command again after a call to the command's undo method.
        Specified by:
        redoCommand in interface ICommand
        Parameters:
        monitor - a progress monitor
        Throws:
